title: Yama Configuration Schema
description: Schema for Yama YAML configuration files

project.description: Project metadata (new syntax). Alternative to top-level name/version.

name.description: Project name (legacy syntax, use 'project.name' for new syntax)

version.description: Project version (e.g., '1.0.0') (legacy syntax, use 'project.version' for new syntax)

plugins.description: Plugin configurations. Array format where items can be strings (plugin name) or objects (plugin name as key with config).

oneOf.description: Plugin object with name as key and config as value

operations.description: Operation definitions. Operations are first-class citizens with naming conventions for automatic path/method inference. Format: operationName: OutputType (shorthand) or operationName: { input, output, parent, handler, hooks, filter } (full config).

oneOf.description: Shorthand: Output schema name (e.g., 'Post', 'PostSummary[]'). Input, method, and path are inferred from operation name.
Shorthand: No response body (204 No Content). Use for delete operations that don't return data.
Shorthand: 'id' for standard get-by-id, or schema name

parent.description: Parent entity for nested resources (e.g., 'Post' for listComments creates /posts/{postId}/comments)

handler.description: Path to custom handler file (only needed for complex logic)

hooks.description: Lifecycle hooks for simple customization without full handler

roles.description: Required roles (user must have at least one)

check.description: Path to custom policy check handler

url.description: Database connection URL. Use ':memory:' for in-memory testing (PGlite)

permissions.description: List of permissions for this role (supports wildcards: '*', 'posts:*')

mode.description: Validation mode: 'static' for hardcoded credentials, 'database' for database lookup

identifier.description: Identifier (username, email, etc.) for static mode

userEntity.description: Entity name to query for database mode (e.g., 'User')

identifierField.description: Field name to match identifier against in database mode (default: 'email')

passwordField.description: Field name containing password hash in database mode (default: 'passwordHash')

maxRequests.description: Maximum number of requests allowed in the window

keyBy.description: How to identify clients: 'ip' (by IP address), 'user' (by authenticated user ID), or 'both'

store.description: Storage backend: 'memory' (in-memory, single-instance) or 'cache' (uses cache adapter from plugin - works with Redis, Memcached, etc.)

onFailure.description: Behavior when cache/store is unavailable: 'fail-open' (allow requests, graceful degradation) or 'fail-closed' (deny requests, more secure)

enabled.description: Enable realtime events for this entity

watchFields.description: Which fields trigger update events (default: all)

channelPrefix.description: Custom channel prefix (default: entity name lowercase)

default.description: Default rate limit applied to all operations

max.description: Maximum number of requests in the window

oneOf.description: Reference to a named rate limit preset

cache.description: Cache configuration (optional - cache is configured via plugins)

enabled.description: Enable/disable caching for this operation (default: true)

rate.description: Sample rate for requests (0-1, e.g., 0.1 = 10% of requests)

errors.description: Sample rate for errors (usually 1.0 to always track errors)

config.description: Configuration schema for environment variables. Provides T3-style validation at startup with type-safe access via ctx.config.

required.description: Whether this config value is required

envVar.description: Override environment variable name (default: key name)

types.description: Reusable custom type definitions (e.g., 'Money: decimal(19, 4, min: 0)', 'Email: email(255)', 'Slug: slug(3..100)')

entities.description: Entity definitions (legacy - use 'schemas:' instead). This key is supported for backward compatibility. Prefer using 'schemas:' for new projects.

primaryKey.description: Composite primary key (array of field names). For single field primary keys, use 'primary: true' in the field definition.

fields.description: Entity fields. Supports new concise syntax (e.g., 'email: email(255)! unique', 'price: money(usd, min: 0)!', 'username: slug(3..100)! unique') or expanded object syntax. Also supports inline relations (e.g., 'author: User!', 'posts: Post[]', 'tags: Tag[] through:post_tags') and modifiers (e.g., 'readonly', 'sensitive', 'writeOnly', 'generated', 'autoUpdate'). New types: email, url, phone, slug, money(currency), decimal(p,s), int8, int16, int32, int64, uint, timestamp, timestamptz, timestamplocal, date, time, interval, json, jsonb, binary, base64, enum(values...). Examples: 'id: uuid! readonly generated', 'email: email(255)! unique', 'price: money(usd, min: 0)!', 'publishedAt: timestamp?', 'tags: string[](max: 10)'.

oneOf.description: New concise syntax: 'type!' (required), 'type?' (nullable), 'type(params)' (with parameters), 'type[]' (array), 'type(min..max)' (range), 'type = default' (default value). Types: string, text, email, url, phone, slug, uuid, int, int8, int16, int32, int64, uint, decimal(p,s), money(currency), float, double, boolean, date, time, timestamp, timestamptz, timestamplocal, interval, json, jsonb, binary, base64, enum(values...). Modifiers: readonly, unique, indexed, writeOnly, sensitive, generated, autoUpdate. Examples: 'email: email(255)! unique', 'price: money(usd, min: 0)!', 'username: slug(3..100)! unique', 'age: int(0..120)', 'tags: string[](max: 10)', 'createdAt: timestamp readonly = now()'

type.description: Field type. New types: email, url, phone, slug, money, int8, int16, int32, int64, uint, timestamptz, timestamplocal, interval, binary, base64

dbColumn.description: Explicit DB column name (for snake_case mapping)

oneOf.description: Composite primary key (array of field names)
Composite primary key (array of field names)
Set to false to exclude from API

precision.description: Precision for decimal type (total number of digits)

scale.description: Scale for decimal type (number of digits after decimal point)

writeOnly.description: Write-only field (excluded from responses, e.g., password)

sensitive.description: Sensitive field (excluded from responses by default)

relations.description: Entity relationships. Supports shorthand syntax (e.g., 'hasMany(Post)', 'belongsTo(User)') or full object syntax. Note: Relations can also be defined inline in the 'fields:' section using entity references (e.g., 'author: User!', 'posts: Post[]'). Explicit relations in this section take precedence over inline relations.

oneOf.description: Shorthand relation syntax: hasMany(Entity), belongsTo(Entity), hasOne(Entity), manyToMany(Entity)

entity.description: Target entity name (legacy, use 'target' for new syntax)

references.description: Column name in target table to reference (default: primary key)

foreignKeyTarget.description: Foreign key target field (for manyToMany, legacy)

joinColumns.description: Custom join column names for manyToMany

onDelete.description: On delete behavior for belongsTo/hasMany relations

onUpdate.description: On update behavior for belongsTo/hasMany relations

where.description: Filter condition for hasMany relations (e.g., { published: true })

timestamps.description: Add timestamps to join table (for manyToMany)

fields.description: Extra fields on join table (for manyToMany)

validations.description: Field validations (declarative). Maps field names to validation rules. Legacy format - use 'validation:' for new syntax.

validation.description: Validation rules (new syntax). Supports field-level and entity-level validation.

rule.description: Validation rule type (email, between, regex, etc.)

computed.description: Computed fields (virtual fields calculated from other fields)

dependsOn.description: Fields this computed field depends on

variants.description: Schema variants for auto-generating DTOs (create, update, response, etc.)

exclude.description: Fields to exclude from this variant

pick.description: Fields to include (if specified, only these fields are included)

override.description: Override field definitions for this variant

partial.description: Make all fields optional (for update variants)

hooks.description: Entity lifecycle hooks (paths to handler files)

softDelete.description: Enable soft deletes (adds deletedAt timestamp instead of hard delete)

indexes.description: Database indexes. Supports shorthand syntax (array of field names or single field name) or full object syntax.

oneOf.description: Composite index as array of field names (e.g., [authorId, publishedAt])

apiSchema.description: Optional custom API schema name (default: entity name)

oneOf.description: Array of HTTP methods to generate (e.g., ['GET', 'POST'])

path.description: Custom path override for this method

inputType.description: Custom input schema name for this method (overrides default Create/Update input schemas)

responseType.description: Custom response schema name for this method (overrides default entity schema)

oneOf.description: Method-specific configuration. Supports individual methods (e.g., 'GET', 'POST') or method groups: 'read' (GET), 'write'/'mutate' (POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE), 'create' (POST), 'update' (PUT, PATCH), 'delete' (DELETE). Example: { 'read': { auth: { required: false } }, 'write': { auth: { required: true, roles: ['admin'] } } }

path.description: Base path for CRUD endpoints (default: pluralized entity name, e.g., 'Example' -> '/examples')

auth.description: Auth configuration applied to all CRUD endpoints

inputTypes.description: Custom input types per HTTP method. Overrides default generated input schemas (e.g., CreateEntityInput, UpdateEntityInput). Example: { 'POST': 'CustomCreateInput', 'PATCH': 'UpdateStatusInput' }

responseTypes.description: Custom response types per HTTP method. Use GET_LIST for list endpoints, GET_ONE for single item endpoints. Example: { 'GET_LIST': 'TodoSummary', 'GET_ONE': 'TodoDetail', 'POST': 'Todo' }

crud.description: Optional CRUD endpoint generation. Set to true to generate all CRUD endpoints, or use object for fine-grained control.

schemas.description: Schema definitions (preferred). Supports new concise type syntax (e.g., 'id: uuid! readonly generated', 'email: email(255)! unique', 'price: money(usd, min: 0)!', 'username: slug(3..100)! unique'). Also supports variants for auto-generating DTOs (create, update, response), computed fields, and database configuration via 'database:' section. Use 'schemas:' as the primary way to define your data models. The 'entities:' key is supported as a fallback for backward compatibility.

source.description: Source entity/schema name. This schema is derived from the source, inheriting all fields. Use with 'fields' to override specific fields or add new ones, or with 'include' to select a subset.

include.description: Include only these fields from source (used with 'source'). If specified, only these fields are included.

fields.description: Schema fields. Supports new concise syntax (e.g., 'email: email(255)! unique', 'price: money(usd, min: 0)!', 'username: slug(3..100)! unique') or expanded object syntax. Can also use inline nested types (e.g., 'author: { id: uuid!, name: string! }').

oneOf.description: New concise syntax: 'type!' (required), 'type?' (nullable), 'type(params)' (with parameters), 'type[]' (array), 'type(min..max)' (range), 'type = default' (default value). Types: string, text, email, url, phone, slug, uuid, int, int8, int16, int32, int64, uint, decimal(p,s), money(currency), float, double, boolean, date, time, timestamp, timestamptz, timestamplocal, interval, json, jsonb, binary, base64, enum(values...). Modifiers: readonly, unique, indexed, writeOnly, sensitive, generated, autoUpdate. Examples: 'email: email(255)! unique', 'price: money(usd, min: 0)!', 'username: slug(3..100)! unique', 'age: int(0..120)', 'tags: string[](max: 10)', 'createdAt: timestamp readonly = now()'. Inline nested types: 'author: { id: uuid!, name: string! }'

computed.description: Computed fields (virtual fields calculated from other fields or expressions)

table.description: Database table name (for schemas that map to database tables)

enabled.description: Enable or disable this REST API configuration

basePath.description: Base path prefix for all endpoints (e.g., '/api/v1')

defaultPolicy.description: Default policy name to apply to all operations (default: 'public')

operations.description: Operations to expose in this API. Can be operation names (strings) or objects with policy/path overrides.

exclude.description: Operations to exclude from this API

endpoints.description: REST API endpoints (legacy - use operations instead)

field.description: Entity field name to filter on

oneOf.description: Enable pagination with defaults (offset type, limit=20)

pageSize.description: Number of items per page for page-based pagination

cursorField.description: Field to use for cursor pagination (default: primary key)

metadata.description: Specific metadata fields to include (default: all fields included)

oneOf.description: Request body schema. Can be a schema reference (type: 'Post') or full schema definition with fields:.

body.description: Request body schema. Can be a string (shorthand), schema reference object, or full schema definition with fields:.

oneOf.description: Response schema. Can be a schema reference (type: 'Post') or full schema definition (type: 'object' with properties).

response.description: Response schema. Can be a string (shorthand), schema reference object, or full schema definition.

permissions.description: Required permissions (user must have at least one, derived from their roles)

provider.description: Provider type or name to use

maxRequests.description: Maximum number of requests allowed in the window

keyBy.description: How to identify clients (overrides global setting)
